intro: Schizodium obliquum subsp. clavigerum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved schizodium, is a flowering plant species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects.
